Blog comments reportedly not working;
'Firstly, I got two alerts that there were new comments, but they don’t seem to be in CMS? (at least, they’re not appearing on the top of the list. Also, the ‘recent’ comments on the right hand side of the live blog pages are actually really old ones (from 2008):'

And recent comments on page not updating with the latest ones.

-----Original Message-----
From: Deborah Elstein 
Sent: 03 February 2011 14:59
To: 'support@postcms.zendesk.com'
Cc: Zara Rabinowicz
Subject: FW: New blog comment

This is further to my other email - comment that's not appearing on the CMS blog comment page

-----Original Message-----
From: support@kitsite.com [mailto:support@kitsite.com] 
Sent: 03 February 2011 14:44
To: Deborah Elstein; Kathryn Gilbert
Subject: New blog comment



A new comment has been posted to this blog post ( http://www.london2012.com/photos/2010/8/outside-of-the-basketball-arena-with-internal-seating-to-be-installed-69888.php ) has been submitted.

Click here to view/approve it: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/comments/blog
 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A copy of the comment can be seen below:   
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Now this is more like it! I love it!

I think I figured out what is going on;

This URL only shows 'blog' comments
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/comments/blog

I don't know / can't remember if we ever had a page to admin Photo comments (do you know if we did?)

But for now I adjusted so that Photo comments also come though to the blog comment approval screen, would you prefer that anyway?

re. recent comments, oh dear it looks like that has never displayed recent comments, good news is I've just fixed it !
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/blog/includes/recent-comments.php

Jamie

ps. there seems to be something odd about logging in to comment and https (which is a seperate issue / we're looking at)

Hi

Getting photo/news and blog comments all to the same screen is the best idea. Will the comments also get emailed to the ed. Team now?
cheers

Hi Zara,

It's just going to Deborah.elstein and kathryn.gilbert at the moment as email to your other group address didn't seem to be working.

Can try again with the team@ address (what was it?) or add a few more people (although if we add too many people in the to address you may find that your firewall starts to filter them out).

Jamie
No, those two are the ones it needs to go to, glad it’s working again.

It may be to do with the '&', but that should not really be happening. We will look into it. 

Regarding image sizes: I think you can get those from the 'Filter' drop down when looking at pictures: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/pictures/

I think the sizes are: 	460, 700, 108x108, 209x160, 220x120, 490x174, 500x173, 500x213, 500x248, 61x44, 90x63
Hey Deb, the images are cropped to 460x250 pixel.

Hi
This is high priority, to be done by 1st feb.
Create separate pages para sponsors/ Olympic sponsors.

Some of this is hard coded, or I'd do it myself.

http://www.london2012.com/about-us/the-people-delivering-the-games/international-and-uk-partners/index.php
Rename: for 'London 2012 Olympic Games partners'
Olympic page- remove sainsburys logo from page.

-          Change the 2012 logo to one that only features the Olympic 2012 logo (with no para mention) Hard coded, so can't do it.#
New page; name  'London 2012 Paralympic Games partners'



-Paralympic page: Create with Paralympic logo

and create separate para sponsors page



Templates need to be changed to accommodate a single static logo.



Can you show me this in draft for approval before it goes live, so I can get it signed off?



Cheers

Zara

Many thanks for your help with this, an additional page would be great.

End of next week would be great, if you have a screen grab that I could check before it goes live - that would be really helpful.

If we could double check we have the right L2012 emblem on each page and the  title of links as "London 2012 Olympic Games partners" and "London 2012 Paralympic Games partners"

Kind regard Mo

Morag

Cc: Liz Goulding
Subject: Paralympic sponsor recognition on current website

I know you have incorporated separate OG and PG only recognition pages in the new GT website, which is great. Thank you

Is there any way we could get   http://www.london2012.com/about-us/the-people-delivering-the-games/international-and-uk-partners/index.php page to rotate to show OG partners with L2012 OG logo (top left) and then flip to PG partners with L2012 PG logo in corner (top left) ??

or could we add in another page, so that we have both

London 2012 Olympic Games partners (with OG partner logo's) and the L2012 OG logo in top left
and

London 2012 Paralympic Games partners (with PG partner logos) and the L2012 PG logo in the top left corner

IF you can let me know what might be possible, a timeframe and if CSE would need to contribute towards any development costs.

Many thanks for your help

Mo

Hi Morag,

Is this what you we're expecting?
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/volunteer/timeline.php

Before you run off and use it a couple of questions for you::

  - Do you want us to drop the <h1> title, if the title is on the Flash file it's probably not needed, but..
  - Do you want space for text at the top of this page? (in which case the <h1> might not look so odd).

I also have a couple of other small issues that may need to go back to McCann

  - The Flash file as supplied was too wide @ 727x866 to fit, it needs to be 718px wide (for now I have scaled both height and width so it fits). 

     Solution: You may want to get McCann to resupply a 718px SWF file so it fits perfectly.

 - The /sound sub folder has files with CamelCaps case and underscore, we flatten these when they get imported into the CMS so that "Accreditation_and_Uniform_Collection.mp3" becomes "accreditation-and-uniform-collection.mp3". I have uploaded the files direct to the webserver as a workaround, which for the short term should work fine, but it does mean that we have files that aren't in the CMS so if we republish to the Staging server (for example) these files may not get published.

    Solution: You may want to get McCann to resupply a SWF file which references lowercase mp3 files with dashes instead of underscores ie. accreditation-and-uniform-collection.mp3

--------------

We are yet to fully test cross browser, but if you can let me know if if the page above is what you are after we'll get onto that.

thanks

Jamie

Hi Morag,

** Please read previous comment (above) first (which is the main response) **

But I just remembered we also need a fall back image or even just a text version for non Flash users (*) 

- We could just create a big text area that is replaced with the SWF when the page is loaded if Flash is supported (else the user just gets the rich text area)
- We could just got for an image (if you can fit all the info on it)
- We could just got for an image + image map (so that each item on the image opens a new page)
- We could just got for an image + image map + some javascript  (so that each item on the image opens a popup - further question over whether this is styled and also what we do if the user doesn't have JS).

If you go for an  image it needs to be 718px wide (see my comment about Flash size above).

The text fall back is starting to look the easiest :)

* The non-flash user base now includes iPhone/iPad (which don't have and can't install Flash). Which means the non-flash user base is now no longer just a bunch of users who just refuse to install Flash for ideological reasons ;-) but actually perfectly normal everyday users.

Flash file size is too wide @ 727x866 - argh, the brief told them to make this no larger than 700 px. How big a deal do you think it is to scale it as you have done - will we lose quality? If I get McCann to supply a 718 px file I'm not sure how long it will take to produce - we need to get this live asap so am a bit loathe to ask....

CamelCaps case and underscore - again, slightly loathe to get McCann to do this at the moment as we need to get it live. I think it is fairly unlikely to change once put live. Do you think it will be a big problem?

Can you remove the Int Inspiration banner from the top of this page? It should be a normal Games Maker page.

Morag

comments.value:
Specifically:
- how is form data checked for malicious data input
- where and in what form will collected data be stored

Note to self: 

from jamie's spec: "The user will enter submit a URL which will then be run though a regular expression to 
strip out the domain name."

[I imagine we will also run the URL through the php function htmlentities ]

"As we have six web servers and no single central DB on the front end we will submit and store these entries in the CMS."

Summary of data flow for Website Checker:

1. The user submits a URL in a web form
2. The URL is run though a regular expression to strip out the domain name on the client side before submission
3. The submitted domain is run through the htmlentities php function on the server side
4. As we have six web servers and no single central database on the front end, the submitted domain will be stored in the CMS
5. An export of all fake domains can be made from the CMS as and when required in a CSV format

I think that's it.

comments.value:
Liz, I am raising this in you name, because we think it might be of interest. After the last bulk republication, we did a bit of investigation as to why it is taking so long and it looks like a significant factor is dynamically-generated navigation components, that are in many cases the same for several pages. We think we could greatly speed up publication by caching these components, without upsetting the navigation. Time required is 1.5 days. 

What do you reckon?
I will ponder. Probably not a high priority item, but it seems to be sensible.
After discussion with Zara this morning, I have reset this to high. We will do the work as time allows.

Obviously missed out on the full context of this - but can someone please do a quick explanation? We don't normally do a mass site-repub, so wasn't sure how relevant this was in the grand scheme of things.
________________________________

Actually, it possibly happens more frequently than you realise. Probably 6-12 times per year. Most recently last week. And likely again when the SEO URLs go live next month. The last republish took something like 12 hours, which is getting to the point where it has the potential to cause disruption to editorial.

I really do think it would be worthwhile.

Hi Liz

Danny explained that they’d done a lot of the work on this, and at this point should either proceed with it (whilst still fresh) or shelve it as not important.

Looking at the ticket, it would be useful to be able to republish things more quickly going forward, and though is marked high would be actually done in about 3 weeks. It’s not the most important thing to have done, but would likely be useful in case of a crisis, so thought would be best to action rather than shelve it.

Does that make sense?
Cheers
Zara

Makes sense - to clarify (danny) this will aid the speed of batch republishing, not just general republishing, right?

If you've already done some work on it, I'm happy to finish it off 1.5 days more work - so long as it doesn't interfere with the other high-priority tickets.

I'm conscious that we have a few of these smaller tickets outstanding at the moment, and I want to make sure we get them sorted before we move on to other things. Also, I'd like to have a better look at where we stand on projected days work in Jan - I know we have loads of days to use from last year, but I want to make sure we don't get too carried away! Danny, could you pull together a quick report?

Also (as a casual reminder) Kitsite probably shouldn't start working on such things and then mention them part-way through, even if it's for our own good :-)
________________________________

(danny, an in-progress response!)

> Also (as a casual reminder) Kitsite probably shouldn't start working on
> such things and then mention them part-way through, even if it's for
> our own good :-) 

Hi Liz, we would never embark on unauthorised work and /expect/ it to be unconditionally okayed by you (unless there was an obvious matter of urgency!. However, we would be neglecting our duty if we weren't constantly trying to find ways to improve the cms and/or live website. We obviously run the risk of our investigations NOT leading to any authorised work obviously but ... that's a risk that WE bear.

...

(still in progress - danny does this look ok?)

> Also (as a casual reminder) Kitsite probably shouldn't start working on
> such things and then mention them part-way through, even if it's for
> our own good :-)

Hi Liz, we would never embark on unauthorised work and /expect/ it to be unconditionally okayed by you (unless it was an obvious emergency!). However, we would be neglecting our duty to you and our other clients if we weren't constantly trying to find ways to improve the cms and live website. We obviously run the risk of our investigations NOT leading to any authorised work but ... that's a risk that we bear. 

Danny is correct to emphasize that batch-republishing will be /particularly/ speeded up. However, general ad-hoc publication will also be speeded up (although not quite as dramatically). We are confident that this work will knock up to 40% off the time required for a site republication - possibly even more (after some fine-tuning).

Yes, it looks good to me. And to clarify, i thought I had said to Zara that we had done "some investigation" rather than "a lot of the work", the point being that it would make sense to proceed while it was fresh in our memories.

Although given that you have just put the work live and we are charging 1.5 days for it, that argument may be superfluous.

In answer to the latter question "what will we need to do to ensure that visitors come to the section through first landing on the splash page?

In order to do what that (ie. only show the splash page once) we'd need to set a cookie and then check it each time, which we could do but that getting more complex.

SO....

- is the splash page just for direct / external visitors? if so send them to splash.php
- does the splash page always show first, if so we'll make the splash page the home page and the current hub we'll rename to hub.php or something (we'd also need to hide it from the navigation)

If what you what is it to show it only once we'd need to set cookies, which given the timings, may not be a wise route to take unless it's essential.

Jamie

1. New splash page - there will be a new splash page in the manner of the splash page we used for Volunteering. McCann have produced a swf file which should be dropped into an 'empty' template which only has the top and bottom navigation on it. See the assets in Splash Page.zip attached.

2. New Int Insp hub page template (the page after the splash page) - McCann have designed a new template (design attached as Hub page design.jpg) which is pretty similar to existing templates except that it has an editable media pod at the top, similar to media pod on the Volunteering pages. The other new element is the new banner at the top of the page, for which assets are also available.

3. New Int Ins content pages - these will remain basically as they are but we want all the pages to have an International Inspiration banner with the keyline running across them, as per the Sports pages (which means also removing the current keyline at the bottom of the pages). The colour of these banners will alternate between the four London 2012 brand colours. There is also a new blue angular feature box in the right hand column (as per the hub page design). I will provide psd files for these four coloured banners shortly but in terms of size they will be coloured variants on the banner in the Hub page design.

Happy to chat through these when you have had a look at the assets. Time-wise, I would love this to be available for launch at the end of January - is that possible?

Many thanks!
Morag
